Detailed Description

AtronSocketApi.h provides an interface for an ATRON module simulated in the Unified Simulator for Self-Reconfigurable Robots (USSR). API calls to the modules are communicated to USSR though a socket. Similar messages (asynchronous events) to the moduels are send from USSR to the module controller through a seperate socket. In total two sockets are used per module. Initially a call to atronApi_setup(...) must be made. This API builds on top of CommandSender.h and EventListner.h.

Author:
David Johan Christensen, Modular Robotics Lab, AdapTronics Group, Maresk Institute, University of Southern Denmark
Note:
This software is distributed under the BSD open-source license.

int atronApi_canConnect ( int  i  ) 

Test whether a specific connector is close enough to another connector to enable it to connect (not possible on physical modules)

int atronApi_canDisconnect ( int  i  ) 

Test whether a specific connector can disconnect, meaning that it is a male connector currently connected to another module.

Cause the main joint to stop rotating and presumably break actively (the latter is not implemented yet)

Causes the main joint to stop rotating

void atronApi_setup ( int  portRC,
int  portEvent,
char *  host,
void(*)(char *, char, char)  msgHandler 
)

Setup the API, two free socket ports portRC and portEvent must be provided for commands and events respectively. Also a host (usually LOCALHOST) and a pointer to a function (e.g. handleMessage(char* message, char messageSize, char channel)) that will handle messages received from other modules.

int atronApi_wasSend (  ) 

If the last request to send a command was send correctly

void atronApi_yield (  ) 

Yield the module, that is wait one physicstimestep in the USSR simulator
